title: The 50 Best Bible Verses for Graduation

steps.title: Romans 8:28
steps.content: Romans 8:28 “And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to His purpose.” [1] X Research source Interpretation : This verse is one of the most popular to cite from the Bible on graduation day; it encourages new graduates to keep what is right and good in mind as they embark on their life’s journey.

steps.title: 2 Corinthians 9:8
steps.content: 2 Corinthians 9:8 “And God is able to make all grace abound to you, so that having all sufficiency in all things at all times, you may abound in every good work.” Interpretation : Graduates can focus on how God is behind all things they seek out after graduation.

steps.title: Matthew 22:21
steps.content: Matthew 22:21 “Then he said to them, ‘Give therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s and to God the things that are God’s.’” [2] X Research source Interpretation : Graduates can separate what they do in the working world from what greater things belong to God.

steps.title: Psalms 119:32
steps.content: Psalms 119:32 “I am eager to learn all that you want me to do; help me to understand more and more.” [3] X Research source Interpretation : It’s possible to understand through faith in God when it comes to a graduate’s purpose in life.

steps.title: Proverbs 24:14
steps.content: Proverbs 24:14 “Wisdom is like honey for your life— if you find it, your future is bright.” Interpretation : This verse deals with the importance of wisdom, and how having it can help create a brilliant future.

steps.title: John 15:8
steps.content: John 15:8 “This is to my Father’s glory that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be my disciples.” Interpretation : Connect the ideas of a person’s success with God’s success, and reflect on thanking God for any success graduates experience.

steps.title: Luke 1:37
steps.content: Luke 1:37 “Nothing is impossible with God.” Interpretation : This is one of the most simple examples of graduation scripture because it shows graduates that, with God, nothing is impossible.

steps.title: Psalm 119:105
steps.content: Psalm 119:105 “Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.” Interpretation : A graduate’s path will be well-lit thanks to their faith in God.

steps.title: Psalm 20:4
steps.content: Psalm 20:4 “May he grant your heart’s desires and make all your plans succeed.” Interpretation : Seek out God’s will to make your life’s dreams come true, whether personal or professional.

steps.title: Proverbs 16:3
steps.content: Proverbs 16:3 “Share your plans with the Lord, and you will succeed.” Interpretation : Trust in God when setting out in the world after graduation so everything you want comes to pass.

steps.title: Psalms 105:4
steps.content: Psalms 105:4 “Look to the Lord and his strength; seek his face always.” Interpretation : Graduates can always make room for God in their lives, no matter where they go or what they do for a living.

steps.title: 1 Corinthians 16:14
steps.content: 1 Corinthians 16:14 “Do everything in love.” Interpretation : Regardless of the work graduates seek, they should always think of love first.

steps.title: Proverbs 4:23
steps.content: Proverbs 4:23 “Above all else guard your heart for it is a wellspring of life.” [4] X Research source Interpretation : When high school graduates study the Bible , they discover that verses like this one encourage them to enter college while taking care of their heart along the way.

steps.title: 1 Timothy 4:12
steps.content: 1 Timothy 4:12 “Don’t let anyone look down on you because you are young, but set an example for the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, and in purity.” Interpretation : Just because a high school graduate is young doesn’t mean they cannot act wise, mature, and thoughtful on their journey.

steps.title: Colossians 3:23
steps.content: Colossians 3:23 “Whatever you do, keep working at it with all your heart, as for the Lord and not for people.” Interpretation : This verse is a reminder for students graduating to remain steadfast and never give up.

steps.title: Isaiah 26:4
steps.content: Isaiah 26:4 “So always trust the Lord because he is forever our mighty rock.” Interpretation : When times get tough as graduates enter college, they can always depend on God.

steps.title: Psalms 20:4
steps.content: Psalms 20:4 “May God do what you want most and let all go well for you.” Interpretation : New graduates should trust that God has a plan for them in everything they do.

steps.title: Proverbs 19:21
steps.content: Proverbs 19:21 “Many are the plans in the mind of a man, but it is the purpose of the Lord that will stand.” [5] X Research source Interpretation : A college graduate’s plans may change, but by meditating on the word of God , they can feel closer to God’s plans for them.

steps.title: Colossians 3:2
steps.content: Colossians 3:2 “Set your minds on things above, not on earthly things.” Interpretation : As college ends and life begins, graduates can always think of their highest selves which God has had a hand in creating.

steps.title: Matthew 5:16
steps.content: Matthew 5:16 “In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.” Interpretation : This Bible verse is a reminder for new graduates to be an example for others who come after them.

steps.title: 2 Timothy 1:7
steps.content: 2 Timothy 1:7 “God’s Spirit doesn’t make cowards out of us. The spirit gives us power, love, and self-control.” [6] X Research source Interpretation : College graduates should treat the freedom of adulthood with responsibility and always remember the concept of love.

steps.title: Romans 12:11
steps.content: Romans 12:11 “Never be lacking in zeal, but keep your spiritual fervor, serving the Lord.” [7] X Research source Interpretation : This verse suggests that graduates keep their youthful excitement, especially when it comes to their faith in God.

steps.title: Proverbs 3:5-6
steps.content: Proverbs 3:5-6 “Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make straight your paths.” [8] X Research source Interpretation : It’s challenging for college graduates to make their way in the world; trusting in God can be the rock they need to fall back on.

steps.title: Proverbs 16:3
steps.content: Proverbs 16:3 “Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.” Interpretation : It won’t be difficult to see their path when graduates follow a professional path in the name of God.

steps.title: Jeremiah 29:11
steps.content: Jeremiah 29:11 “For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, says the Lord, thoughts of peace and not of evil, to give you a future and a hope.” [9] X Research source Interpretation : This is an example of Bible verses for graduation that teach graduates to focus on good instead of evil, which can ensure a positive future.

steps.title: Proverbs 19:21
steps.content: Proverbs 19:21 “Many are the plans in the mind of a man, but it is the purpose of the Lord that will stand.” Interpretation : Graduates can have all the plans in the world, but it’s ultimately God who gives them a purpose.

steps.title: Proverbs 21:5
steps.content: Proverbs 21:5 “Careful planning puts you ahead in the long run; hurry and scurry put you further behind.” [10] X Research source Interpretation : This verse lets graduates know that careful planning creates a solid foundation for their professional lives.

steps.title: Psalms 119:117
steps.content: Psalms 119:117 “Uphold me, and I will be delivered. I will always have regard for your decrees.” Interpretation : New graduates should keep God close to their hearts no matter where their adult life takes them.

steps.title: Deuteronomy 6:5
steps.content: Deuteronomy 6:5 “Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength. Interpretation : Those entering the work world won’t forget that strengthening their love of God can only serve their faith well.

steps.title: Psalm 55:22
steps.content: Psalm 55:22 “Cast your cares on the Lord and he will sustain you; he will never let the righteous fall.” [11] X Research source Interpretation : It’s important to stay moral-minded and pure of heart to remain on the righteous path.

steps.title: 2 Timothy 2:15
steps.content: 2 Timothy 2:15 “Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved by him, a worker who has no need to be ashamed, rightly explaining the word of truth.” [12] X Research source Interpretation : Few things in life are as important as the truth, which gives further meaning to faith in God.

steps.title: Lamentations 3:22-23
steps.content: Lamentations 3:22-23 “The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases, his mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.” [13] X Research source Interpretation : This Bible verse for a graduate emphasizes faith and the many rewards it offers, such as the love of God.

steps.title: James 1:12
steps.content: James 1:12 “God will bless you if you don’t give up when your faith is being tested.” Interpretation : Adult life will bring many obstacles, but keeping the faith is a way for graduates to overcome them.

steps.title: Isaiah 41:10
steps.content: Isaiah 41:10 “So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand. [14] X Research source Interpretation : It’s not easy to go from college student to working adult; this is a reminder of how God never leaves your side.

steps.title: Deuteronomy 31:6
steps.content: Deuteronomy 31:6 “Be strong and of good courage, do not fear nor be afraid of them; for the Lord your God, He is the One who goes with you. He will not leave you nor forsake you.” [15] X Research source Interpretation : No matter who new graduates meet or where they go, God is always by their side in tough times.

steps.title: Joshua 1:9
steps.content: Joshua 1:9 “Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.” Interpretation : Those graduating should stay strong and believe in the mighty power of God who is always their champion.

steps.title: Ephesians 3:20
steps.content: Ephesians 3:20 “Now all glory to God, who is able, through his mighty power at work within us, to accomplish infinitely more than we might ask or think.” Interpretation : When those who graduate need a helping hand, God’s will within can give them the strength to do anything.

steps.title: Isaiah 58:11
steps.content: Isaiah 58:11 “The Lord will guide you always; he will satisfy your needs in a sun-scorched land and will strengthen your frame. You will be like a well-watered garden, like a spring whose waters never fail.” Interpretation : God is there to guide new graduates in any harsh conditions they find themselves in, which allows them to flourish in the world.

steps.title: 1 Corinthians 15:57-58
steps.content: 1 Corinthians 15:57-58 “But thanks be to God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.” [16] X Research source Interpretation : Graduation is a day to celebrate accomplishments, but also dedicate them to God so they have an ultimate purpose in the world.

steps.title: Philippians 4:4
steps.content: Philippians 4:4 “Rejoice in the Lord always; again I will say, rejoice.” [17] X Research source Interpretation : This verse is a considerate way to congratulate someone for their graduation and honor all they’ve accomplished.

steps.title: 1 Corinthians 5:8
steps.content: 1 Corinthians 5:8 “Let us therefore celebrate the festival, not with the old leaven, the leaven of malice and evil, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.” [18] X Research source Interpretation : Graduation is a time of joy, so it’s important to prepare with truth and authenticity whenever possible.

steps.title: Psalm 118:24
steps.content: Psalm 118:24 “This is the day that the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.” [19] X Research source Interpretation : This Bible verse is another thoughtful way to show how much you care about a new graduate’s accomplishments through belief in God.

steps.title: Ecclesiastes 3:4
steps.content: Ecclesiastes 3:4 “A time to weep and a time to laugh, a time to mourn and a time to dance.” [20] X Research source Interpretation : Graduates can remember that their life has opportunities for every experience; they can expect good and bad, but always keep their faith in God throughout.

steps.title: Psalm 149:1
steps.content: Psalm 149:1 “Praise the Lord. Sing to the Lord a new song, his praise in the assembly of his faithful people.” [21] X Research source Interpretation : Celebrate graduation among people of faith who can come together to praise God and support each other’s journey.

steps.title: Romans 12:2
steps.content: Romans 12:2 “And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God.” [22] X Research source Interpretation : When reading the Bible , graduates can notice in this verse that, no matter what the world throws at them, they’ll continue to grow with the help of God’s love.

steps.title: Matthew 5:14
steps.content: Matthew 5:14 “You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden.” Interpretation : This verse suggests to graduates that they hold within themselves something truly special that the world will thank them for giving to it.

steps.title: Ephesians 2:10
steps.content: Ephesians 2:10 “For we are God’s workmanship, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.” Interpretation : New graduates can pursue many kinds of work, but they need to know that they will always remain workers in God.

steps.title: 2 Corinthians 5:17
steps.content: 2 Corinthians 5:17 “Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!” [23] X Research source Interpretation : When you look up this Bible verse , you can understand the idea of being born again in the sense that a new graduate’s life is completely different from the life as a student they had before.

steps.title: 2 Corinthians 3:18
steps.content: 2 Corinthians 3:18 “And we all, who with unveiled faces contemplate the Lord’s glory, are being transformed into his image with ever-increasing glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit.” [24] X Research source Interpretation : Graduates can revel in the glory of God in whatever path they choose in life as long as they stay faithful and dedicated to God’s word.

steps.title: Isaiah 40:31
steps.content: Isaiah 40:31 “But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.” [25] X Research source Interpretation : God can help new graduates fly high and make a real difference in the world.
